a.title: Legend for this format

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.Timing.repeat` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Timing.repeat` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `Timing.repeat` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `Timing.repeat` 0..1 `Element`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `Timing.repeat` 0..1 `Element` * R4B: `Timing.repeat` 0..1 `Element` * R4: `Timing.repeat` 0..1 `Element`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `Timing.repeat` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Timing.repeat`, but has no comparisons.

short.value: When the event is to occur

definition.value: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Length/Range of lengths, or (Start and/or end) limits

definition.value: Either a duration for the length of the timing schedule, a range of possible length, or outer bounds for start and/or end limits of the timing schedule.

requirements.value: Element `Timing.repeat.bounds[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Timing.repeat` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `Timing.repeat.bounds[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Timing.repeat`. Element `Timing.repeat.bounds[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Timing.repeat.bounds[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `Timing.repeat.bounds[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Timing.repeat`.
